document_data.name: Screeb
document_data.mainbody:
'''Screeb''' was a drunkard and a ruffian who frequented the [[Black Eye]] tavern of [[Westgate]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Har har! "Oh, please, leave me in peace! What's the matter? Did they also take your manhood when they stripped your paladin-ness away? "Don't hurt me, good sirs, I'm just a poor drunken eunuch! And a traitor"... har har!''|Screeb}}
document_data.Description: Screeb was a middle-aged man with fair skin and gray hair. His facial hair was trimmed into a thin pencil-like shape.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, Screeb and two of his drunkard friends stumbled across [[Mantides]], a disgraced [[paladin]] of [[Lathander]] who was drowning his sorrows in [[ale]] at Black Eye in Westgate's [[Harbor Loop]]. The drunkards accused Mantides of being a washed-out drunk, insinuated he lost his holy [[sword]] and that the [[Church of Lathander|church]] took Mantides's manhood when it stripped him of paladinhood. Despite harassment, Mantides did not stoop to violence. Screeb accused the ex-paladin of being a coward, and his group stumbled out of the tavern, leaving Mantides alone.
